byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston, and David Montgomery from Austin, Tex. Liam Stack contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and DAVID MONTGOMERY

abstract: Harris County, Texas, Sheriff's Dept announces arrest of Shannon J Miles in fatal shooting of deputy at Houston gas station; officials claim officer Darren J Goforth was singled out for his uniform; local community fondly remembers husband and father of two, holds vigil and places memorials at station.
lead_paragraph: Officials said they had not confirmed a motive for the killing of Texas Deputy Darren H. Goforth, who was fueling his patrol car outside Houston, but tied it to protests over police shootings.

headline.main: Texas Deputy Killed ‘Because He Wore a Uniform,’ Sheriff Says
headline.print_headline: Texas Deputy Killed ‘Because He Wore a Uniform,’ Sheriff Says

snippet: Officials said they had not confirmed a motive for the killing of Texas Deputy Darren H. Goforth, who was fueling his patrol car outside Houston, but tied it to protests over police shootings.
